legal system would
lack continuity, and this would make it unfair and ineffective. Of course, past
decisions that were mistaken or immoral should not be continued. That is
why  precedents  can  be  overturned.Nonetheless,  our  legal  system  assumes
that, if there is no adequate reason to overturn a precedent or to distinguish
the precedent from the present case, then the precedent provides some reason
to decide the present case in the same way as the precedent. This general doc-
